item.title: Bayes’ Theorem
item.description: This post will explore Bayes’ theorem, and its applicability to our problem of making good guesses. The definition of conditional probability. \[ P(A|B) = \frac{P(A,B)}{P(B)}\] Getting a conjunction from conditional probability. \[ P(A,B) = P(A|B)P(B) = P(B|A)P(A)\] Bayes’ theorem. \[ P(A|B) = \frac{P(B|A)P(A)}{P(B)}\] The law of total probability. \[P(B) = \sum_{j=1}^{n}P(B,A_j)\] Bayes theorem with the law of total probability. \[ P(A_i|B) = \frac{P(B|A_i)P(A_i)}{\sum_{j=1}^{n} P(B|A_j)P(A_j)}\] Continous bayes theorem.
